sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The mad dialogue sung by Mr. Leveridge and Mrs. Lynsey ; sett by Mr. Purcell. Richmond heiress. Behold the man Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695. D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723. Richmond heiress. Leveridge, Richard, 1670 or 71-1758. Lindsey, Mrs. (Mary), fl. 1697-1715?
1 score ([1+] leaf).
s.n., [London? : 1700?]
The dialogue song (Z. 608/1a-n) sung in T. D'Urfey's play 'The Richmond heiress'. For two voices and continuo (figured bass). Caption title. Without imprint. Date and place of publication suggested by Wing. Imperfect: 2000 microform ed. lacks all after first leaf. First line: Behold, behold the man that with gigantick might. Reproduction of original in: British Library.
=======
